parameters: The (d1) means the sheet only has one direction - so
you don't have to have 4 versions of the same sprite
in a file to make it work with RMMV.
Yes, that means you can take ANY old one-frame image,
put a $ on the beginning of the filename, and (f1)(d1)
at the end, and use it, no other edits required.
Whatran was made by the Frogotto and Friends team and is CC0
The rotFacePlayer function will rotate an event to face
the player (used in enemy attacks above ^).
This guy will now rotate every frame to face you.
The rotFacePlayerFlip function will rotate an event to
face the player, AND will flip it horizontally
if it's going the wrong way.
Now this eye monster will always be upright while
You can use it to lay out your diagonal sprite sheets.
(it goes just like the number pad, skipping 5)
Alternatively, you can use any of the existing
If you had sprites formatted for quasi/victor/galv
you can add them in with a tag.

The spin point of this angel is around the base of her
hitbox, as defined with the with the standard (y24)(x24)
sprite offset commands commands that mog uses.
-The spin point does not move if you alter the collision
box location with altimit, or use yanfly's sprite offset
plugins to move the sprite that way.
